intro: Gynoxys cuzcoensis, commonly known as the Cuzco beauty, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its ornamental, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
